CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 16, 1952, pg. 28, reads: "First '52 Red Cross Class - Members of the first Red Cross nurse training class of '52 at Hill City are shown upon completion of their prescribed course of study recently. The Red Cross would like to train at least one person in every family as a civil defense precaution.  Courses are free.  Left to right, seated, Mrs. Mattie Martin, Mrs. Alyce Calloway, Mrs. Lucille Johnson and Mrs. Olivia Johnson.  Standing: Mrs. Frances Wilson, Mrs. Sweetie Matthews, Mrs. Eunice Cook, registered nurse and instructor of the group; Mrs. Ida Shives and Mrs. Louise Germany. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Nurses, seated from left: Mattie Martin, Alyce Calloway, Lucille Johnson, Olivia Johnson; standing: Frances Wilson, Sweetie Matthews, Eunice Cook, Ida Shives, and Louise Germany, gathered behind table with Red Cross flag
